Package main.java.model

Class FlexiblePortfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.model.AbstractPortfolio
      • main.java.model.FlexiblePortfolio
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Portfolio
    public class FlexiblePortfolio
extends AbstractPortfolio
    This class represents a flexible portfolio that extends the abstractPortfolio class.

    A Flexible portfolio is basically a portfolio on which any number of buy sell transactions can be done. It overrides all the methods that are specific to flexible portfolio like getComposition, getValueOnDate,Transact a stock etc.

      • executePendingTransactions

        public void executePendingTransactions​(PriceProvider priceProvider)
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        A method which executes pending transactions of all the strategies. It uses the dateUntilCalculated field and starts executing strategy from that date.
        Parameters:
        priceProvider - priceProvider that should be used to get the prices of the stock.

      • executeStrategy

        public void executeStrategy​(java.util.List<StockWeight> stockAndWeights,
                            java.lang.Double investmentAmount,
                            java.time.LocalDate dateOfTransaction,
                            java.lang.Double commission,
                            PriceProvider priceProvider)
                     throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        This method is used to execute a strategy on a particular portfolio.
        Parameters:
        stockAndWeights - stockWeights of the stocks that needs to be invested as part of the strategy.
        investmentAmount - amount that needs to be invested as part of the strategy.
        dateOfTransaction - date on which the strategy needs to be executed.
        commission - commission associated with the strategy.
        priceProvider - priceProvider that should be used to fetch the prices of the stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.if the strategy cannot be executed for the given date 2.Arguments passed to the method are invalid

      • getPortfolioComposition

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPortfolioComposition​(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Returns composition of the portfolio on that particular date.

        It returns "NA" if stock wasn't bought until the given date

        Parameters:
        date - Date on which portfolio composition needs to be shown.
        Returns:
        list of string where each string represents a stock within the portfolio.

      • getPortfolioValueOnDate

        public StockPriceResponseWrapper getPortfolioValueOnDate​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                                                         PriceProvider priceProvider)
        Gets the portfolio value on the given date. It factors in the quantity of each stock that was present with the user until the given date.
        Parameters:
        date - The date on which value needs to be determined.
        priceProvider - The price provider object which provides the price of stocks on given date
        Returns:
        StockPriceResponseWrapper which internally has list of success and failure list of the stocks depending on whether the price fetch failed or passed.

                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio

        Parameters:

        percentMap - the percent map.
        provider - an object of PriceProvider to get information related stocks Price.
        Throws:

      • transactStock

        public Portfolio transactStock​(java.lang.String stockSymbol,
                               java.lang.String stockName,
                               java.lang.Double stockQty,
                               Util.TransactionType transactionType,
                               java.time.LocalDate transactionDate,
                               java.lang.Double commission)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        This method is used to transact(buy/sell) a stock on a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        stockSymbol - stockSymbol that needs to be transacted.
        stockName - name of the stock that needs to be transacted.
        stockQty - Quantity of the stock transacted.
        transactionType - type of the transaction(buy/sell).
        transactionDate - date of the transaction.
        commission - commission associated with the transaction.
        Returns:
        Portfolio object after doing transaction of the given stock in the portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If the transaction is invalid or if it cannot co-exist with the previously mentioned transactions for a particular stock.

      • getCostBasis

        public double getCostBasis​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                           PriceProvider priceProvider)
                    throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        This method allows us to return the cost basis on a portfolio until a date specified by the user.

        For a given set of transactions, it would basically calculate the buy order until the day which user specifies. If there are no transactions the cost basis is zero. It will also consider all the commissions which where paid by the user for all the previous transactions.

        Parameters:
        date - date on which cost basis needs to be determined
        priceProvider - the price provider through which prices would be determined.
        Returns:
        the cost basis of portfolio until that date
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If some error occurred while fetching the price of stock on a particular date.
